page.title: 01Pressendye N E of Tarland
page.content: This area includes farmland, tree plantations, and exposed hillsides. The farmland is marginal to the hill ground on th east side of the area. Fields are worked to altitudes over 400m to grow barley turnips potatoes and to provide hay and grazing for cattle & sheep. Most of the farms are amalgamtions of smaller units but are still struggling to provide a living for the families that run them.Many of the hillsides steeply sloping ground betwen 300 and 500 metres altitude, have been planted with spruce and pine trees. Being relatively young, these plantations are mostly dense and impenetrable on the soutehrn slopes some shelter belts exist for live stock protection self seeded pines are scatteed on te higher slopes but struggle against exposure tothe elements,
